channel.title: No one know how to fix it?
channel.description:
I made a runecrafting method but when i call the method (in the objects clicks) it only do it once i want it to loop as many time i have an essence in my inventory (loop this): [code] addSkillXP(xpAmount, 20); [/code] need more info?
I want it to loop as many times i have essence the xp --- example: if i have [b]three[/b] essence it will do this: addSkillXP(xpAmount, 20); [b]three[/b] times help me fix that shit.

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

It should work like that, because you keep on checking whether you have rune/pure essence until you run out of them and add that amount of exp to skill number 20.

That’s the point of a while loop, you keep on looping through it, until the condition (in this case playerHasItem(1436)|| playerHasItem(7936) is false. And since you have that command added with both rune and pure essence, it should work…

item.source: No one know how to fix it?

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

It means you have an else somewhere which is not related to an if:

You see, you’re checking whether you have rune essence or pure essence with a while, but you cannot use an else with a while. A possible fix would be using a boolean and check if you are rcing or not:

[code] public void startRC(int levelReq, int xpAmount, int replaceItemID){
private boolean isRcing = false; //you’re not rcing yet
while(playerHasItem(1436) || playerHasItem(7936)){
isRcing = true;//you are rcing
if(freeSlots() > 0){
if(actionTimer == 0){
if(playerLevel[20] >= levelReq){
if(playerHasItem(1436)){
replaceItem(1436, replaceItemID);
startAnimation(791);
actionTimer = 10;
checkRuneEss(xpAmount);
}else{
if(playerHasItem(7936)){
replaceItem(7936, replaceItemID);
startAnimation(791);
checkPureEss(xpAmount);
actionTimer = 10;
}
}
}else{
sendMessage(“Weird, I feel strong but not enough, i need “+levelReq+” runecrafting level.”);
}
}

                    }else{
						sendMessage("You dont have enough place in your inventory.");
                        }
            }
			if(!isRcing){ //if you are not rcing because you don't have any sort of essence
               sendMessage("I guess I need pure essence or rune essence.");
               return;
			}
}[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

Oh boy, Delta… Everything crammed into 1 class…

Euhm you can try instead of playerItems.length to place 28 (since your inventory has 28 spaces)

Also, that addSkill must be OUTSIDE of your for loop, because in the for loop you’ll check how many rune and pure essence you have in your inventory and add 1 to the counter for each one and after it add the XP amount to the skill.

I g2g now, so I won’t be able to help you any further for a couple of hours.

Read full topic

private boolean itemInInv(int itemID, int inSlot, boolean checkInv) {
  if (checkInv) {

        if (playerItems[i] == itemID + 1) {
           return true;
            }
     }
  } else {
     if (playerItems[inSlot] == itemID + 1) {
        return true;
     }
  }
    return false;
}

private void replaceItem(int oldItem, int newItem) {
    for (int i = 0; i < 28; i++) {
     if (itemInInv(oldItem, i, false)) {
            deleteItem(oldItem, i, 1);
            addItem(newItem, 1);// * multi   -   for multi option.

addSkillXP(xpAmount * counter, 20);

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

Euhm maybe because it’s Delta. Maybe the items in your inventory aren’t stored in the playerItem array.

You see, it will check how long playerItems is, but if that is not the array used for it, it will never be correct. Try replacing that with whatever array is set for the inventory items and it should work fine I suppose.

EDIT: you could send me a copy of your whole class, that might I might be able to find out what array is ment for the inventory items if you can’t figure it out yourself, but normally it shouldn’t be a problem so try first.

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

The counter is to check how many times you have that item in your inventory. You can loop through everything like 28 times but that would be nonsense.

Say you have 10 rune essence in your inventory, you’ll loop through your whole inventory, and each time it finds an essence, it will add 1 to the counter (0 on default).

In the end, the counter will be 10, meaning you will add 10 times the xp you receive per essence to your runecrafting experience.

For your other question:

Euhmm I don’t see why you would call for the runeEssAmount method since basically everything that’s in there, is also in that startRC method.
However, in your method, you’ll add experience to your RC regardless of what item you have in your inventory because of this:

if(playerHasItem(7936)){ replaceItem(7936, replaceItemID); startAnimation(791); for(int l = 0; l < playerItems.length; l++){ addSkillXP(xpAmount, 20); }

Basically, this says that if you have the item 7936 (pure essence) it will replace it, and loop through your whole bag and add the xpAmount to your RC skill for each item. This means that if you’d have say a Dragon Dagger, it will also give experience for it, since you’re not checking whether the current slot is a Pure Essence. Also, it will only remove 1 essence and you’re not looking whether you can multiply runes or not.

Try modifying your startRC method with bits of the method I provided. If you insist on using that runeEssAmount method, you should place in your startRC method

This is how I would make the method:

[code]public void startRC(int levelReq, int xpAmount, int replaceItemID){
int counter = 0;
if(freeSlots() > 0){
if(actionTimer == 0){
if(playerLevel[20] >= levelReq){
if(playerHasItem(1436) || playerHasItem(7936)){
startAnimation(791);
for(int i = 0; i < playerItems.length; i++){
if(c.playerItems[i] == 1436)){
counter++;
replaceItem(1436, replaceItemID);
}else{
if(c.playerItems[i] == 7936)){
counter++;
replaceItem(7936, replaceItemID);
}
}

			}
			addSkillXP(xpAmount*counter, 20);
			actionTimer = 10;
			     }else{
				sendMessage("I guess i need pure essence or rune essence.");
                 }
          }else{
              sendMessage("Wierd, i feel strong but not enough, i need "+levelReq+" runecrafting level.");
          }
        } 
    }else
       sendMessage("You dont have enough place in your inventory.");
       resetAnimation();
    }[/code]

PS: Make sure you keep your spaces and everything correct to make it look more structured. Else you can easily get into trouble…

EDIT: I didn’t keep record with multiplying runes, but use an enum for it, that’s the way to go.

item.title: No one know how to fix it?
item.dc:creator: @JavaLearner JavaLearner
item.description:
@JavaLearner wrote:

Is this PI? If so…

Make a new method, like

[code]public void handleRuneCrafting(){
int counter = 0;
for(int i = 0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++){
if(c.playerItems[i] == 1436){
counter++;
c.getItems().removeItem(playerItems[i], 1);
}
}

c.getPA().addSkillXP(xpAmount * counter, 20);
}
[/code]

Basically you’ll loop once through the inventory, and each time it finds an unnoted essence, a counter will go up by 1 and remove the essence. Now, after he looped through it, it will multiply your xpAmount with the amount of found essence and add it to skill # 20.

Also: keep in mind that this will give you the same EXP on every altar. If you wish this to be different, you could change the method to get an int as parameter with an exp, so you could say like:

public void handleRuneCrafting(int xpPerEss){ int counter = 0; for(int i = 0; i < c.playerItems.length; i++){ if(c.playerItems[i] == 1436){ counter++; c.getItems().removeItem(playerItems[i], 1); } } int xp = (int) xpPerEss * counter ; //this is just in case you want to work with floating point numbers c.getPA().addSkillXP(xp, 20); }

This way, you need to give the amount of exp you would receive per essence… Let’s say 100 for air rune and 2500 for blood runes…

If you’d have 10 essence, that would mean for air runes, the xp you’d receive would be:
10*100 = 1000 xp

For blood runes:
10*2500 = 25000 xp
